{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3328524,"name":"Alex Kalinin","username":"sherplung","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sherplung/{size}/216476_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-09T16:11:10.217Z","cooked":"

This is something of a pet project that I’ve been working on on and off for a few weeks. I was a bit annoyed when I noticed that there was no option for a configurable timing belt in MKCad, so I made a very rudimentary configurable belt in Onshape. It worked, but I felt that I could do better. This here, is better:

This is my fully-featured configurable timing belt tool for Onshape.

With it, you can generate a GT2 3mm or HTD 5mm timing belt that is the exact length and size for any combination of pulley and belt tooth counts.

You can specify:

  • Whether or not you want the belt to have teeth modeled (useful if your main assembly is already barely loading)
  • The tooth count of each pulley
  • The tooth count of the belt
  • How wide the belt is
  • Whether or not you want the center-center distance to be calculated by the CAD or manually inputted by you (useful if you want to put it in an assembly)
  • Whether or not mate connectors should be provided (useful if you hate mate connectors)

I have not yet seen a configurable belt in Onshape that has this many options or this much flexibility.

I have added as many features and configuration options as I have been able to come up with to this. The one thing that I have been unable to solve is making the fillets between the teeth and the belt body pattern correctly without just making them part of the sketch that patterns. It is entirely inconsequential, but it minorly irritates me that the fillets clip into the belt at the bends. If anyone knows how you would fix this, it would be very appreciated.

This required a lot of math and a lot of searching for exact dimensions (you’d be shocked how hard it was to find them). If you have any feature recommendations, feel free to send them. If you have experience in featureScript, I would like to see if it would be useful to port this to featureScript. If you are part of the MKCad team, I would love to collaborate.

Where I got my data:

Pitch diameter equation

Center-center distance equation

GT2 tooth profile

HTD tooth profile
